channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024091131
item.description:
Report X-2024091131

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: NEW WINDSOR
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED- UNMARKED PACKAGES IN WHITE PLASTIC. ONE OPENED ON THE BELT REVEALING A BOX MARKED UN1046 COMPRESSED HELIUM. THE BOX HAD HANDLES AS OPENINGS REVEALING THE ACTUAL TANK. 23 PACKAGES TOTAL - ADDTL TR #S - 1ZC1G375YW74441743, 1ZC1G375YW77321484, 1ZC1G375YW67651208, 1ZC1G375YW85170319, 1ZC1G375YW91283436, 1ZC1G375YW88761336, 1ZC1G375YW96349679,1ZC1G375YW46593089, 1ZC1G375YW81064772, 1ZC1G375YW46478838, 1ZC1G375YW45930411, 1ZC1G375YW48378335, 1ZC1G375YW53990225, 1ZC1G375YW45657360, 1ZC1G375YW66651648, 1ZC1G375YW46122613, 1ZC1G375YW89754173, 1ZC1G375YW84951585, 1ZC1G375YW88519321, 1ZC1G375YW65131149, 1ZC1G375YW57512912 AND 1ZC1G375YW95389520.

item.title: Report E-2024090360
item.description:
Report E-2024090360

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:04 EST on 8/23, XPO-XNW contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 ounces of "SUPER DIAMOND CLEAR 350" from a 5gal poly pail impacting the shrink wrap of a pallet. The freight was damaged during loading by XAY. The spill was cleaned before notifying ERTS. ERTS generated waste ID: 216296-1 and reported to Chemtrec who provided report number: 2024082300022. ERTS reported the spill to New York DEC and spoke with Operator 57 who provided the report number: 2404850. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090245
item.description:
Report E-2024090245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer, material handler discovered a drum that was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that there was a small crack in the bottom of the drum that was slightly dripping. No action contributed to this failure other than it being a defective container. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the defective drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090213
item.description:
Report E-2024090213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAB experienced a UN1170 Ethyl Alcohol release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10' x 15' area of the concrete dock floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift blade. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 09/07/2024 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL Express UC facility, located at 12-12 33rd Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1266, Perfumery products, Class 3 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Receptacle Material of Construction: Glass Package Capacity: 50 mi Amount in Package: 50ml Number in Shipment: 2 Number failed: 2
